product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: While I like the features of this camera, including the long optical lens and the focus control feature, this camera failed after less that two years of use.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: I needed a pocket camera for stills to go where I didn't want to drag my much larger Panasonic Lumix GH-4 and my collection of MFT lenses.,As others have mentioned this camera has a viewfinder.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: It would be unreasonable to expect this little thing to perform as well as a full-size or micro-four-thirds sensor camera with a suite of fast lenses at 10x (or more) the price.,I haven't used the flash much yet, but I do see how one can end up covering the flash with a finger.,Some other observations about the ZS60 are these:,  - I am impressed with the auto-macro focus abilities of the lens.,  - Silent mode also turns off the flash.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: The lens protection blades look fragile and when the camera is in a shirt pocket I'd like to protect them from branches and other things without having to put the camera into a padded bag., - I wish that the markings on the buttons were a tad larger so that I didn't so often need to put on my glasses to read 'em as I am getting to know the controls.,Overall this is a nice pocket camera.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: I have a FZ1000 and FZ300 cameras....both from Panasonic with getting great photos with both cameras, I simply needed something more compact for my job requiring me to carry a camera for photos on items quickly.,Pros:,Pretty hefty and good feeling for a smaller digital camera,Excellent Leica lens,Excellent 30X optical optical lens,Great photo qualities during the day without flash or indoors with flash,Can take 4K photos and RAW too,Easy to use,Rear touch LCD LCD viewfinder.,Easy to navigate typical Panasonic camera menu system,Uses SD, SDHC & SDXC cards,Video qualities are good,Has a rear optical viewfinder with auto EVF sensor,Has focus setting modes as well,No burst lag as this is a very quick camera overall,Cons:,Battery life a little short [get extra battery & extra charger[s],The EVF & sensor are really close to each other,Tiny EVF....could be a bit bigger,Smallish hand grip....could be a little bigger,Bad flash location....[right above the small front hand grip]....I have taken some low-flash photos and my hand while holding the camera produced some "hand shadows" when using the flash while holding onto the camera.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: If you want a smaller compact digital camera with a decent-sized optical optical lens and get pretty good photos overall [mostly outdoors during the day with no flash or indoors with flash], then this Panasonic ZS60 digital camera should do the job just fine.

product: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

review: This is about the only thing I would like changed on this camera.... the ability to recharge with a USB so I could recharge in the USB port in my vehicle.,If you do a lot of photography out in nature where there is a chance of getting rained on, or in snow conditions, this is a very good camera due to the weather-proofing and dust-proofing.,This is a very good "bridge camera"... more functions then a "point-and'shoot", without having to expense up to DSLR with multiple lenses.

review: I can not ask more, this cam has wide angel lens and wifi function, means you can download photo to your phone or PC without hard wire it.

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It doesn't have the fast lens and other features of my FZ200, but noise control is better, IMO, so you can use higher ISOs.

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This enabled me to get some spectacular shots sight seeing in Arizona - shots that would have either required 2 hour hikes or just not possible otherwise were easy with 60x optical optical,I'm not a photography expert, and at the moment I don't want to have to learn about / spend the money on a DSLR and all the associated lenses, etc - however I still wanted a camera that had focus features like burst speed, sensitivity, etc so that I could grow into the camera over time,The electronic view finder is surprisingly useful to help get level shots,Tips/advice:,- If you're going to use focus focus, try the same shot with automatic focus as well - I used focus focus for a number of extreme distance shots that looked ok on the LCD LCD but are blurry on larger LCDs, where shots of other scenes I used automatic focus and came out great - this means many of my extreme distance shots at the Grand Canyon North Rim were blurry when they probably would have been fine in automatic focus mode,- If you want to use focus focus times I recommend getting a tripod, since I did not have one the long focus time shots I took were just blurry,- Instead of having to walk further away from / closer to the scene, it is extremely helpful to have the easy to use and plentiful optical control, even for close range shots (few inches to 10ft) - just optical in a bit to crop out what you don't want and put more of an emphasis on the subject in the photo

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I don't think vignetting will be a problem using 52mm filters as the lens is way smaller than the filter threads on the camera.

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I may change them as time goes on, but I find it really great to be able to get Bracketing with the push of a button.,I don't care much for the lens cap, and ordered a better 55mm one on Amazon.,I use filters as it seems more often than not, I end up with my fingerprints on the lens filter.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: For most beginners Panasonic is great but for low flash demanding, or detail showing photos, you will need something with F/2.8 or better.,Cons: F stop could have been 2.8 or better,Pros: Small, flashweight, quick, good quality video and photos (even on print), flipping LCD for videographers, good battery (you still need two if you are taking it to field trip) very good construction, Leica lens is a plus, Sony image sensor is a plus, very vivid compression/jpg processing.,Ask me ANY questions before you buy a camera (Point and shoot or DSLR) and I will respond.

product: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The best lenses even come with no optical at all.

product: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: If your goal is to get the best quality you can get, and this camera does not make you happy, I do not think that the L32 would make you much happier so you will have to move to professional cameras that have detachable lenses and you are looking at many times the price.,There is something that you will not like about this camera and the only reason I gave it 4 stars.

product: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: When we consider buying a camera, we do it because we want something better than what we already have in our pocket and that usually means that we are looking for optical optical and quality lenses with quality video capabilities.,If you are still interested in this camera, here are some things that you may want to know:,1) It has an easy to view 2.7" LCD.,2) Operation is very simple and the menus are easy to figure out without having to read a focus.,3) It uses 2 AA battery that you can buy everywhere.

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The stability at full optical is great, much better,than the Nikon, for example.,The lens is awesome, If you lens, be careful.

review: It has an amazing lens, works great in low flash, is tiny, easy to use and takes much better pictures than my iPhone 4.

product: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: For it's ability, features, and performance, I would say this camera is the best overall value of any camera in it's class being sold today, but that's just one mans opinion.,One thing I almost forgot to mention in closing, is that it has a 55mm thread at the end of the lens so you can attach filters for special effects.

product: Panasonic Lumix 4K Digital Camera with 30X LEICA DC Vario-ELMAR Lens F3.3-6.4, 18 Megapixels, and High Sensitivity Sensor - Point and Shoot Camera - DMC-ZS60K (BLACK)
review: The optical lens is great; having a real viewfinder (though digital) is really nice for taking photos in bright flash; having a flip LCD is nice for selfies and taking photos from a low perspective; the size while not being truly 'pocketable' is a lot better than a full size SLR when on-the-go; the battery life is good; USB charging is nice; video quality, like photos, is excellent in dayflash.

product: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: With the Sony, the darn thing is now sharp at f2.8 - that's huge for me as I was getting ready to sell this lens and upgrade to the Tamron when they offer their native Sony glass.,Aside from lens performance, high ISO shots are simply amazing - even at 12,800, they are better than 1600 on my 7D - changes everything for me based on what and how I shoot.

product: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: Arguably the Sony A6400, which is the closest direct competitor, has sflashly better autofocus and a more versatile front-facing flip LCD, but if you like some of the Fuji-distinctive professional features like focus control dials, film simulation modes, and clean output of 10-bit 4:2:2 over HDMI, you can stop looking right now and just buy the X-T30.,Is the X-T30 good enough to tempt you from your current system of lenses to the Fuji ecosystem?

product: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: Check out the various demos online of the video quality, especially if you can download the original file and not rely on overly-compressioned uploads like the ones you'll see here or on a video sharing site.,â¶ Convenient HANDLING and extreme PORTABILITY: you can buy this camera and a Fuji pancake lens for portability that rivals a large smartphone (albeit too thick for most pockets), but with focus controls readily available at your fingertips that bring back the joy of photography.

product: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: But, if you're really starting out fresh with your next choice of a camera body (and locking yourself into a system of lenses), use this as a jumping off point for your research.,â¶ For STILL images, the X-T30's larger sensor and higher pixel count will produce much cleaner, lower-noise images.
